Package aima.core.logic.propositional.parsing.ast

Class Sentence

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.logic.propositional.parsing.ast.Sentence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ParseTreeNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicSentence, ComplexSentence
    public abstract class Sentence
extends java.lang.Object
implements ParseTreeNode
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 244.

    The base of the knowledge representation language for propositional logic. Note: this class hierarchy defines the abstract syntax representation used for representing propositional logic.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Ravi Mohan

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      <A,​R>
      R      		 accept​(PLVisitor<A,​R> plv, A arg)
      Allow a PLVisitor to walk over the abstract syntax tree represented by this Sentence.
      java.lang.String bracketSentenceIfNecessary​(Connective parentConnective, Sentence childSentence)
      Utility routine that will create a string representation of a given Sentence and place it inside brackets if it is a complex sentence that has lower precedence than this complex sentence.

      Note: this is a form of pretty printing, whereby we only add brackets in the concrete syntax representation as needed to ensure it can be parsed back again into an equivalent abstract syntax representation used here.

        public Sentence()

    • Method Detail

      • getConnective

        public Connective getConnective()
        Returns:
        the logical connective associated with this sentence if it has one (i.e. is a ComplexSentence), null otherwise.

      • getNumberSimplerSentences

        public int getNumberSimplerSentences()
        Returns:
        the number of simpler sentences contained in this sentence. Will only be > 0 if a Complex Sentence.

      • getSimplerSentence

        public Sentence getSimplerSentence​(int offset)
        Get the simplified sentence, at the specified offset (starts at 0), contained by this Sentence if it is a Complex Sentence, null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset of the contained simplified sentence to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the simplified sentence, at the specified offset, contained by this sentence (if a complex sentence), null otherwise.

      • isNotSentence

        public boolean isNotSentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence with a Not connective, false otherwise.

      • isAndSentence

        public boolean isAndSentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence with an And connective, false otherwise.

      • isOrSentence

        public boolean isOrSentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence with an Or connective, false otherwise.

      • isImplicationSentence

        public boolean isImplicationSentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence with an Implication connective, false otherwise.

      • isBiconditionalSentence

        public boolean isBiconditionalSentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence with a Biconditional connective, false otherwise.

      • isPropositionSymbol

        public boolean isPropositionSymbol()
        Returns:
        true if a proposition symbol, false otherwise.

      • isUnarySentence

        public boolean isUnarySentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence containing a single simpler sentence, false otherwise.

      • isBinarySentence

        public boolean isBinarySentence()
        Returns:
        true if a complex sentence containing two simpler sentences, false otherwise.

      • accept

        public <A,​R> R accept​(PLVisitor<A,​R> plv,
                            A arg)
        Allow a PLVisitor to walk over the abstract syntax tree represented by this Sentence.
        Parameters:
        plv - a Propositional Logic visitor.
        arg - an optional argument for use by the visior.
        Returns:
        a result specific to the visitors behavior.

      • bracketSentenceIfNecessary

        public java.lang.String bracketSentenceIfNecessary​(Connective parentConnective,
                                                   Sentence childSentence)
        Utility routine that will create a string representation of a given Sentence and place it inside brackets if it is a complex sentence that has lower precedence than this complex sentence.

        Note: this is a form of pretty printing, whereby we only add brackets in the concrete syntax representation as needed to ensure it can be parsed back again into an equivalent abstract syntax representation used here.
        Parameters:
        parentConnective - the connective of the parent sentence.
        childSentence - a simpler child sentence.
        Returns:
        a String representation of the Sentence, bracketed if the parent based on its connective has higher precedence.

      • newDisjunction

        public static Sentence newDisjunction​(Sentence... disjuncts)
        Create a disjunction of disjuncts.
        Parameters:
        disjuncts - the disjuncts from which to create the disjunction.
        Returns:
        a disjunction of the given disjuncts.

      • newDisjunction

        public static Sentence newDisjunction​(java.util.List<? extends Sentence> disjuncts)
        Create a disjunction of disjuncts.
        Parameters:
        disjuncts - the disjuncts from which to create the disjunction.
        Returns:
        a disjunction of the given disjuncts.

        public static Sentence newConjunction​(Sentence... conjuncts)
